title: Here's how Trump's gift for coining catchphrases could backfire
text: “A typical White House doesn’t need to finesse because they have a president who understands that technique already,” said Frank Luntz, who has spent decades advising Republicans in the art of using rhetoric to frame debates. “Finesse and Donald Trump are not two words you use in the same sentence. But you always have to put in the ‘but.’ This has worked for him.”
summary:
“A typical White House doesn’t need to finesse because they have a president who understands that technique already,” said Frank Luntz, who has spent decades advising Republicans in the art of using rhetoric to frame debates.
“Finesse and Donald Trump are not two words you use in the same sentence.
But you always have to put in the ‘but.’ This has worked for him.”
